channel.title: Strange 'Ant' problem
channel.description:
When using the RSCD Sprite Editor I receive this error : ‘ant’ is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.
Usually this is an easy fix but no matter what I do I can't seem to set my PATH environment variable properly. Currently it is : C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32\Wbem;C:\apache-ant-1.8.0RC1\bin
I've tried lots of tutorials and they all told me to just add "C:\apache-ant-1.8.0RC1\bin " with a semi-colon. There was one problem, the first time I accidentally deleted what was already there so I found out what my default should be and you see that as "C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32\Wbem"
My computer's OS is Windows Vista Home Premium X64
Any help would be appreciated greatly, feel free to ask any questions.

item.title: Strange 'Ant' problem
item.dc:creator: @Zecronious Zecronious
item.description:
@Zecronious wrote:

FIXED

You guys were a bit far off sorry.
The PATH variable needs to be set to where the ant.bat is located, not the java/bin folder. In the end it worked with: C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32\Wbem;C:\apache-ant-1.8.0RC1\bin
I just had to restart my computer.

Thank you for trying to help me anyway.

Read full topic

item.title: Strange 'Ant' problem
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

You know it is possible to actually open your C drive and navigate around until you find JDK…

Its in Program Files
or Program Files (x86)

Look in the Java folder…

Read full topic

item.title: Strange 'Ant' problem
item.dc:creator: @Zecronious Zecronious
item.description:
@Zecronious wrote:

That’s what I’m saying, “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;” doesn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Strange 'Ant' problem
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

…You said at system32

SO! its at program files, ok so your code will be:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin; THAT WILL BE YOUR PATH VARIABLE, COPY AND PASTE IT INTO VALUE

Read full topic

item.title: Strange 'Ant' problem
item.dc:creator: @Zecronious Zecronious
item.description:
@Zecronious wrote:

Okay, I do have a system 32 folder located at : c:\windows\system32 . There is no java folder in system32 however I do see files such as java.exe, javaw.exe and javaws.exe .

The directory where I installed Java 1.6.20 is located at : C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20

Read full topic

item.title: Strange 'Ant' problem
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[size=12pt]ALRIGHT LETS FIX THIS![/size] Ok so when u open ur c: drive, what folders do you see? Do you lots of them and one of them that include system32?
if yes, so far your code will be C:\system32 if not, tell me what u see. Then in system32, do you see a java folder? if yes, then ur code is C:\System32\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;
Now replace that 20 with the current version you have and that will be your path variable.

If there is a folder in between C disk and system32, do this C:\(your folder name here)\system32\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;

It’s like finding your java folder. So first go to ur C disk, and try to find java. Record everything you do for example: c: then you wright the folder you went to next, then the next folder, then the next, and so on untill you reach java. beside java put this: \jdk1.6.0_(java version, for now i’ll put 20)20. so this will be your finishing code: C:\(next folder\(next folder)\(repeat next folder untill java)\java\jdk1.6.0_20 REMEMBER TO REPLACE THE 20 WITH THE VERSION YOU HAVE OF JAVA!

Hope this helped

Read full topic

item.title: Strange 'Ant' problem
item.dc:creator: @Zecronious Zecronious
item.description:
@Zecronious wrote:

Because I installed java into program files, I changed the PATH to :
C:\WINDOWS\system32;C:\WINDOWS;C:\WINDOWS\System32\Wbem;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin

I am still getting the same error, perhaps I didn’t understand something?

Read full topic

item.title: Strange 'Ant' problem
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

tell me where you put your java file. If on system32, this should be the code for PATH

C:\System32\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;

replace the 20 with the current version you have.

if it’s in Program files: Put this code

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;

same thing, replace the 20 with the version you have.

Read full topic

When using the RSCD Sprite Editor I receive this error :

Usually this is an easy fix but no matter what I do I can’t seem to set my PATH environment variable properly.
